alert.note: Alert for Osceola; Southern Brevard County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 7:43AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Brevard and northeastern Osceola Counties through 845 AM EDT... At 741 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holopaw, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Rockledge, Camp Holly Fish Camp, Holopaw and Harmony. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
